text: Im currently setting up a multi language site, and have two languages up and running. But when it comes to the menus, I'm curious if I have to manually change all the adresses in the cloned meny, rather than to add a {{system.language.code}} to the menu. So If the page url is /en/about.html The system code will be 'en' and continue to add that in the href="/{{code}}{{ link.url }}" ?

Yes, all manual work, unless you have the same slug on both languages exept the language code part (propaply not), then you could add the slug manually on the menu (not optimal, if the page url changes you'll have to change it in the menu manually as it won't update automatically) and add the language code part in the menu module based on the page language
Thanks! Seems like its best to just make the menu manually in the menu admin ATM.
